summary: Eugene Milligan is identified as the Chief of CCS/GLOBE. A memo dated February 5, 1969, from Milligan to the Office of the General Counsel addresses questions regarding Thomas Lee Roberts' relationship with Herbert Itkin and the Conestoga Group. The memo clarifies when LPGLOBE became aware of their proposal to Roberts. The documents suggest Milligan's involvement in addressing concerns and providing information related to the Itkin case and associated individuals.
significance: Eugene Milligan's significance in the JFK context is related to his role as Chief of CCS/GLOBE and his involvement in addressing questions and providing information related to the Herbert Itkin case, which involved individuals with connections to the CIA and FBI. His memo clarifies LPGLOBE's awareness of the proposal to Roberts, suggesting his role in managing and clarifying information within the organization regarding potentially sensitive connections.
